availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel E. Myers (Baltimore, Maryland, police officer, justice of the peace and magistrate.)

body.p: Baltimore, Maryland, police officer, justice of the peace and magistrate. Married to Martha Myers. Father of Mary E. A. Myers and Daniel A. Myers. Police officer in Baltimore, Baltimore County, Maryland, in 1850. Justice of the Peace in Baltimore, Maryland on December 20, 1859. Magistrate in Baltimore in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850) Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, 8th Ward City of Baltimore, 399A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United State (1860) Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, 8th Ward Baltimore City, 350.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870) Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, 8th Ward Baltimore City, 316B.
"Death of the Warden of the Jail," The Daily Exchange (Baltimore, Maryland), The Sun (Baltimore, Maryland), August 17, 1870, p. 4.
"Funeral of the Late Daniel E. Myers," The Sun (Baltimore, Maryland), August 20, 1870, p. 4.
“In the Circuit Court for Baltimore,” The Daily Exchange (Baltimore, Maryland), January 9, 1860.
